isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - ACTUATOR MOTOR, MODE DOOR

note.para: Refer to Figure 32 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Remove the passenger side instrument panel by pulling the top of the cover away from the IP to release the spring clips, then lift the cover up.
Remove nine screws from the heater trim cover (4).
Remove the cover by pulling it straight back.
Disconnect the electrical plug connected to the mode door actuator motor (9).
Remove the two screws securing the actuator (9) to the heater housing (1), and pull the actuator straight off of the mode door shaft.

caution.para: In the following step, never force the actuator drive collar into position. If the drive collar position must be changed, follow the following procedures. Forcing the drive collar may result in a broken actuator.

step1.para: Carefully slip the actuator (9) onto the end of the mode door shaft so that the mounting holes are properly aligned, if possible. If alignment is necessary:

step2.para: Place the actuator into its approximate position.
Connect a 9 Volt battery across pins A and B of the actuator connector, to rotate the drive collar. (Reverse the connection to rotate the drive collar in the opposite direction.)
Allow the drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with the door shaft, and the actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect 9 Volt battery.

step1.para: Secure the actuator to the heater housing (1) using two screws.
Connect the electrical control plug to the mode door actuator motor (9).
Secure the heater trim cover (4) to the heater housing with nine screws.

Install the passenger side instrument panel cover by inserting the two tabs at the bottom of the cover into the sockets in the IP; then press the top of the cover toward the IP to engage the spring clips.

Recalibrate the mode air door by disconnecting the HVAC control panel assembly for at least 15 seconds. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HVAC CONTROL PANEL ASSEMBLY
.
